content: Post-operative ecchymosis following carpal tunnel release
title: Chief Complaint

content: The patient is a post-operative carpal tunnel release patient who reports doing well overall with minimal pain. He has significant ecchymosis involving the arm and hand, particularly near the incision site, which is 1 centimeter from the palm. He is seeking clarification regarding the ecchymosis and the appearance of varied sutures on exam. He is scheduled to return to clinic in 4 weeks for follow-up.
title: HPI Spencer

content: incision . Uh , with varied sutures , um , moderate echinosis , uh , to the arm and hand , um , fingers 1 centimeter from palm gently , um , it'll be planned post-op endocarpal tunnel , return to clinic in 4 weeks for um .
title: Musculoskeletal

content: Return to clinic in 4 weeks for follow-up.
Post-operative care for carpal tunnel release.
